title: RRB 22000 Group D Online form 2026
qualification: matric with iti to graduate (varies by discipline)       age limit   18 to 24 years (age relaxation for reserved categories)       start date for apply   27/12/2025 (10:00 am onwards)       last date for apply   12/01/2026 (05:00 pm)       official website   www.iocl.com/apprenticeships         iocl trade/technician/graduate apprentice recruitment 2026 vacancy details   state-wise total vacancies         state   total vacancies           delhi   120       haryana   30       punjab   49       himachal pradesh   9       chandigarh   30       j&k   8       rajasthan   90       uttar pradesh   140       uttarakhand   25         eligibility criteria   qualifications:     trade apprentice - fitter (code 107):  matriculation with regular full time 2 years iti (fitter) course recognized by ncvt/scvt. pass marks required.   trade apprentice - electrician (code 108):  matriculation with regular full time 2 years iti (electrician) course recognized by ncvt/scvt. pass marks required.   trade apprentice - electronics mechanic (code 109):  matriculation with regular full time 2 years iti (electronics mechanic) course recognized by ncvt/scvt. pass marks required.   trade apprentice - instrument mechanic (code 110):  matriculation with regular full time 2 years iti (instrument mechanic) course recognized by ncvt/scvt. pass marks required.   trade apprentice - machinist (code 111):  matriculation with regular full time 2 years iti (machinist) course recognized by ncvt/scvt. pass marks required.   technician apprentice - mechanical (code 101):  3 years regular full time diploma in mechanical engineering with minimum 50% marks in aggregate for general, ews and obc-ncl & 45% for sc/st/pwbd candidates from institute/university recognized by aicte/ugc.   technician apprentice - electrical (code 102):  3 years regular full time diploma in electrical engineering with minimum 50% marks in aggregate for general, ews and obc-ncl & 45% for sc/st/pwbd candidates from institute/university recognized by aicte/ugc.   technician apprentice - instrumentation (code 103):  3 years regular full time diploma in instrumentation engineering with minimum 50% marks in aggregate for general, ews and obc-ncl & 45% for sc/st/pwbd candidates from institute/university recognized by aicte/ugc.   technician apprentice - civil (code 104):  3 years regular full time diploma in civil engineering with minimum 50% marks in aggregate for general, ews and obc-ncl & 45% for sc/st/pwbd candidates from institute/university recognized by aicte/ugc.   technician apprentice - electrical & electronics (code 105):  3 years regular full time diploma in electrical & electronics engineering with minimum 50% marks in aggregate for general, ews and obc-ncl & 45% for sc/st/pwbd candidates from institute/university recognized by aicte/ugc.   technician apprentice - electronics (code 106):  3 years regular full time diploma in electronics engineering with minimum 50% marks in aggregate for general, ews and obc-ncl & 45% for sc/st/pwbd candidates from institute/university recognized by aicte/ugc.   graduate apprentice (code 112):  regular full time graduate in any discipline (bba/ba/b.com/b.sc.) with minimum 50% marks in aggregate for general, ews and obc-ncl & 45% for sc/st/pwbd candidates from institute/university recognized by aicte/ugc.   trade apprentice - data entry operator fresher (code 113):  class 12th (but below graduate).   trade apprentice - data entry operator skill certificate holders (code 114):  class 12th (but below graduate). additionally, candidates should possess skill certificate of 'domestic data entry operator' for training of less than one year issued by an awarding body recognized under national skill qualifications framework or any other authority recognized by the central government.     essential qualifications:     the qualification prescribed shall be from a recognized university/institute as a full-time regular course in relevant disciplines.   qualification acquired through part-time/correspondence/distance learning mode shall render the candidate not eligible.   wherever cgpa/ogpa or letter grade is awarded, its equivalent aggregate percentage of marks must be indicated in the online application as per the norms adopted by board/university/institute.   diploma under recognized institute/university lateral entry scheme (class xii/iti) admitted in the second year of diploma course shall also be considered eligible subject to meeting prescribed percentage of marks.   candidates must be registered with naps/nats portal with valid and active apprentice registration/enrolment number.   candidates must have an aadhaar seeded bank account enabled for direct benefit transfer (dbt).   candidates must possess pan card and aadhaar card.   candidates must be medically fit as per indian oil's pre-engagement medical standard.     desirable:     preference shall be accorded to candidates applying for apprenticeship training for the first time.   candidates registered with local/state employment exchange(s)/vocational rehabilitation center for person with benchmark disability (pwbd) and meeting the prescribed eligibility criteria are required to apply through naps/nats portal.     experience:     a candidate who has already undergone one apprenticeship training is eligible to apply for a second apprenticeship training, provided that the second apprenticeship is in a different trade from the first.   there shall be a minimum gap of one year between the completion of the first apprenticeship training and commencement of the second apprenticeship training.   no gap shall be required in case of termination of previous apprenticeship training due to failure on the part of the employer.   diploma holder or vocational certificate holder candidates having job experience for a period of one year or more after the attainment of the qualification shall not be eligible to be engaged as apprentice.   candidates possessing higher professional qualifications such as b.e or equivalent, mba or equivalent or mca/ca/icwa, llb or any such equivalent or pursuing higher qualification and having completed the same on or before joining the apprenticeship training shall not be considered eligible.   candidates applying under nats/naps who have completed five years as on 31.12.2025 in relevant discipline after acquiring the prescribed qualification shall not be eligible for engagement as apprentices.     salary/stipend     graduate apprentice:  rs. 4,500/- per month from board of apprenticeship training (boat) through direct benefit transfer (dbt) + remaining amount from iocl + rs. 2,500/- as miscellaneous expenses.   technician apprentice:  rs. 4,000/- per month from board of apprenticeship training (boat) through direct benefit transfer (dbt) + remaining amount from iocl + rs. 2,500/- as miscellaneous expenses.   trade apprentice:  stipend as prescribed under apprentices act, 1961/1973, apprentices rules 1992/2019 (paid in full by iocl) + rs. 2,500/- as miscellaneous expenses.   rate of stipend payable to apprentices per month shall be as prescribed under apprentices act, 1961/1973, apprentices rules 1992/2019 as amended from time to time.   over and above the statutory stipend, an additional amount of rs. 2,500/- shall be paid to the apprentices as miscellaneous expenses.   the cost of stipend borne by the central government shall be restricted to the first-time training only.   part of the graduate and technician apprentice stipend is disbursed by board of apprenticeship training (boat) directly in their bank accounts under the direct benefit transfer (dbt) scheme.     age limit (as on 31-12-2025)     general/ur/ews:  minimum 18 years and maximum 24 years   sc/st:  minimum 18 years and maximum 29 years (relaxation of 5 years)   obc-ncl:  minimum 18 years and maximum 27 years (relaxation of 3 years)   pwbd (general):  minimum 18 years and maximum 34 years (relaxation of 10 years)   pwbd (sc/st):  minimum 18 years and maximum 39 years (relaxation of 15 years)   pwbd (obc-ncl):  minimum 18 years and maximum 37 years (relaxation of 13 years)     application fee     no application fee  is required for applying to iocl apprentice positions.   candidates can apply free of cost through naps/nats portal.     important dates         event   date           advertisement notification date   27.12.2025       date of opening of application (naps/nats portal)   27.12.2025 from 10:00 am onwards       last date of submission of application (naps/nats portal)   12.01.2026 up to 05:00 pm       last date for microsoft office form submission   12.01.2026 up to 05:00 pm       cutoff/reckoning date (qualification & age criteria)   31.12.2025       document verification date   to be intimated on registered email id       period of apprenticeship training   12 months         selection process     there will be no written test/interview for selection.   merit list of all candidates who have applied against respective posts in the portal and meeting the eligibility criteria shall be prepared based on the percentage of marks secured in the prescribed qualification for the post.   in case of two candidates securing same percentage of marks, the candidate with earlier date of birth (older in age) shall be considered.   in case of same date of birth, candidates having a higher percentage marks in matriculation shall be considered.   preference shall be accorded to candidates applying for apprenticeship training for the first time.   the shortlisted candidates will be called for document verification.   candidates will have to complete pre-engagement medical fitness test for being adjudged suitable for engagement.   candidates successfully qualifying document verification and pre-engagement medical fitness shall be adjudged suitable for engagement and shall be issued offer of engagement for apprenticeship training.   an amount of maximum up to rs. 3,000/- shall be reimbursed to the candidate towards expenses incurred for conducting tests/investigations during pre-engagement medical, on production of receipt for the same.     general information/instructions     indianoil corporation limited proposes to engage technician, graduate and trade apprentice under apprentices act, 1961 at its locations in states and uts (delhi, haryana, punjab, chandigarh, himachal pradesh, jammu & kashmir, uttar pradesh, rajasthan, uttarakhand).   reservation will be applicable as per the prescribed percentage for recruitment applicable to the states/ut.   for pwbd (persons with benchmark disability) category, government of india guidelines shall apply.   the reservation for pwbd shall be applied on horizontal basis, across all categories, as per the government guidelines.   pwbd are not eligible to apply for discipline codes 101-111 (technician and trade apprentice - technical).   candidates are required to submit a disability certificate issued by competent authority as per the rights of persons with disabilities rules, 2017.   persons with benchmark disabilities must be capable of performing the task assigned to them/take instructions using suitable aids and appliances.   sc/st/obc (ncl-non creamy layer) candidates applying for unreserved (ur) seats shall be considered subject to their fulfilling the standards applicable to candidates belonging to general category.   candidates can apply for only one discipline code from the advertisement. candidates applying for more than one discipline code will not be considered and their applications will be summarily rejected.   the candidature of the applicant would be provisional and subject to subsequent verification of certificates and testimonials.   in case it is detected at any stage that a candidate does not fulfil the eligibility norms and/or has furnished any incorrect/false information/certificate, his/her candidature will stand cancelled.   engagement of selected candidates is subject to being declared medically fit as per the requirement of the corporation.   the decision of the management will be final and binding on all candidates on all matters relating to eligibility, acceptance or rejection of applications, mode of selection, cancellation of the selection process.   applications which are incomplete or received in any other mode/form, or not fulfilling the eligibility criteria shall not be considered "eligible".   upon completion of the apprenticeship period, the corporation shall have no obligation to offer regular employment to such apprentices nor can an apprentice claim right for employment.   all ex-apprentices will have an equal opportunity along with other candidates to appear   candidates must have an active email id and mobile number which must be valid for at least 1 year as all future communications will take place through email/sms alerts.   any corrigendum/addendum or updates shall be made available on official website: https://www.iocl.com/apprenticeships only.     how to apply     step 1:  register as graduate/technician/trade apprentice online in the following portals under the respective state as per their trades:	   trade apprentice - iti at naps portal: http://www.apprenticeshipindia.gov.in/   trade apprentice - data entry operator at naps portal: http://www.apprenticeshipindia.gov.in/   technician apprentice - diploma at nats portal: https://nats.education.gov.in/student_register.php   graduate apprentice at nats portal: https://nats.education.gov.in/student_register.php       step 2:  ensure that your profile (personal details, educational details, category etc) along with aggregate percentage are appearing correctly in the portal. ensure 100% completion/updation of profile.   step 3:  login to the respective nats/naps portal using user id/email id.   step 4:  apply for the apprenticeship openings/opportunities with the establishment id of indian oil corporation limited (md)-northern region office:	   nats - ndlsdc000005   naps - e05200700003       step 5:  after applying on respective nats/naps portal, candidate must also submit their details along with preferred state and three preferred locations in microsoft office form by visiting: https://forms.office.com/r/jtb9ajalr9 (latest by 12.01.2026, 05:00 pm)   important:  candidates must submit only one response. multiple submission of microsoft form shall not be entertained.   step 6:  keep checking official website https://www.iocl.com/apprenticeships and registered email/mobile for updates regarding document verification.   step 7:  shortlisted candidates will be intimated about document verification on registered email id.   step 8:  appear for document verification with all original documents and self-attested copies.   step 9:  complete pre-engagement medical fitness test.   step 10:  candidates successfully qualifying document verification and medical fitness shall be issued offer of engagement for apprenticeship training.   candidates are advised to carefully read the full advertisement for details of educational qualification and other eligibility criteria before applying.   candidates are requested to apply sufficiently in advance before the closing date.   candidates are advised to periodically visit official website as all future correspondence and latest information shall be only on website and/or by e-mail/sms-alerts.     iocl trade/technician/graduate apprentice important links     official notification pdf :  click here   official website:   click here   naps portal:   click here   nats portal:   click here   microsoft office form:   click here   join arattai channel:   click here   join telegram channel:   click here   join whatsapp channel :  click here   sarkari result :  click here   download mobile app:   click here

title: SBI 996 SCO Online Form 2025
qualification: graduate degree in any discipline       age limit   20 to 28 years       start date for apply   25/12/2025       last date for apply   10/01/2026       official website   www.bankofindia.bank.in         boi apprentice recruitment 2025 vacancy details         state   zone   total vacancy       assam   guwahati   10       bihar   gaya   5       muzaffarpur   6       siwan   10       goa   goa   5       gujarat   ahmedabad   10       gandhinagar   3       rajkot   20       vadodara   10       jharkhand   bokaro   15       dhanbad   15       hazaribagh   15       karnataka   bengaluru   5       hubballi-dharwad   20       kerala   thiruvananthapuram   5       madhya pradesh   dhar   15       jabalpur   10       khandwa   20       ujjain   10       maharashtra   kolhapur   20       raigad   10       ratnagiri   20       solapur   10       new delhi   new delhi   10       odisha   baripada   5       keonjhar   10       punjab   ludhiana   5       rajasthan   jaipur   5       jodhpur   5       tamil nadu   chennai   5       madurai   5       tripura   guwahati   5       uttar pradesh   agra   10       hardoi   10       uttarakhand   dehradun   5       west bengal   howrah   10       kolkata   10       siliguri   20       grand total   400         eligibility criteria     nationality:  candidate must be a citizen of india   educational qualification:  graduate degree in any discipline from a recognized university or any equivalent qualifications recognized by central government   essential qualification:  the candidate should have passed graduation degree between 01.04.2021 and 01.12.2025   experience:  candidate who had training or job experience for a period of one year or more after completing educational qualifications shall not be eligible for being engaged as apprentice   registration:  candidate need to register on apprenticeship portal of national apprenticeship training scheme (nats) at https://nats.education.gov.in   prior apprenticeship:  the candidate should not have undergone apprenticeship either with bank of india or in any other organization earlier   physical fitness:  engagement is subject to being declared medically fit as per requirement of the bank and producing medical fitness certificate from a practicing registered general physician (minimum mbbs)     salary/stipend     total stipend per month:  rs.13,000/- (rupees thirteen thousand only)   bank's contribution:  rs.8,500/- per month   government of india's stipendiary support:  rs.4,500/- per month   payment mode:  stipend will be credited in the saving bank account of apprentices each month after adjusting unauthorised leaves   government share:  rs.4,500/- will be directly credited to the apprentices dbt enabled bank account registered with nats portals through direct beneficiary transfer (dbt) mode   other allowances:  the apprentices are not eligible for any other allowances or benefits     age limit (as on 01.12.2025)     minimum age:  20 years   maximum age:  28 years   date of birth:  the candidate must have been born not earlier than 02.12.1997 and not later than 01.12.2005 (both days inclusive)   age relaxation for sc/st:  5 years   age relaxation for obc (non-creamy layer):  3 years   age relaxation for persons with benchmark disabilities:  10 years   note:  the maximum age limit of 28 years is applicable to general category and ews candidates     application fee         category   application/examination/intimation fees       pwbd candidates   rs.400/- + gst       schedule caste / schedule tribe / all women candidates   rs.600/- + gst       all other candidates   rs.800/- + gst           payment mode:  online payment only   bank transaction charges:  to be borne by the candidate   refund policy:  application fee is non-refundable   note:  application fee to be remitted only on demand by bfsi ssc (scrutinizing/examining body) deputed by the bank     important dates         event   date       notification date   01.12.2025       relevant date for age and qualification   01.12.2025       submission of online application commencing from   25.12.2025       last date for submission of online application   10.01.2026       tentative date of online examination   will be advised separately         selection process     stage 1 - online written test:  the test will consist of 100 questions for 100 marks with total duration of 90 minutes   test components:     general / financial awareness: 25 questions, 25 marks   english language: 25 questions, 25 marks (qualifying nature only)   quantitative & reasoning aptitude: 25 questions, 25 marks   computer knowledge: 25 questions, 25 marks       language:  all tests except english language will be available bilingually (english and hindi)   qualifying marks:  minimum qualifying marks will be decided by bank. sc/st/obc/pwd candidates entitled to 5% relaxation   stage 2 - test of local language:  conducted after qualifying the online written examination. candidates must be proficient in reading, writing, speaking and understanding the local language of the state   exemption from language test:  candidates who produce 10th or 12th standard mark sheet/certificate evidencing having studied the specified opted local language   final merit list:  drawn state wise and category wise based on marks obtained in online examination in descending order   tie breaker:  if marks are equal, merit order will be on the basis of date of birth (senior by age placed higher)   document verification:  candidates must produce original documents along with self-attested photocopies   medical fitness:  candidate must be declared medically fit as per bank requirements     general information/instructions     candidates can apply for engagement in only one state and choose only one zone under that state   the number of training seats mentioned is provisional and may vary according to actual requirements of the bank   bank has right to post apprentices in any branch/offices within the state as per operational requirements   this is neither an employment nor a contract employment in the bank. engaged apprentices will only be "trainees" and not treated as employees/workers   period of engagement shall be restricted to one year apprenticeship training programme   apprenticeship period shall not give the apprentice any lien/right on permanent employment with the bank   no ex-servicemen / disabled ex-servicemen shall be engaged as an apprentice and there is no reservation for them   apprentices are prohibited from joining/forming any union body   bank may issue certificate to candidate upon successful completion of apprenticeship   successful apprentice will be issued a proficiency certificate by board of apprentice training (boat)   bank has the rights to cancel the engagement of apprenticeship at any point of time without prior notice in case of any misconduct   no change of category as well as any other details will be permitted at any stage after registration on the apprenticeship portal   multiple applications will result in only the latest valid application being retained   canvassing in any form will be a disqualification   any resulting dispute arising out of this advertisement shall be subject to the sole jurisdiction of the courts situated at mumbai     how to apply     step 1:  register on the national apprenticeship training scheme (nats) portal at https://nats.education.gov.in by navigating to "student register/login" section   step 2:  after registration, login to the nats portal using user id and password at https://nats.education.gov.in/student_type.php   step 3:  apply for apprenticeship against the advertisement published by "bank of india" by going to the section "apply against advertised vacancies"   step 4:  eligible candidates will receive an email from  [email protected]  within 48 hours of applying on nats portal   step 5:  fill the final "application cum examination fee form" by providing personal data, choice of zone, category, pwbd status   step 6:  make online payment of the requisite examination fee   step 7:  note down the enrolment id issued by nats portal for future reference   step 8:  after successful payment, you will receive an email from  [email protected]  with copy of "application cum examination fee form" within 48 hours   application period:  25.12.2025 to 10.01.2026   mode of application:  online only through nats portal   important:  application process is complete only when examination fee is deposited with bfsi ssc   for help:  refer to the help manual available at https://nats.education.gov.in/assets/manual/student_manual.pdf or email queries to  [email protected]     boi apprentice title: RRB Isolated Category 08/2025 2026
vacancies: Bank of India Credit Officer Online Form 2026
qualification: matriculation or 10th class pass from a recognized board       age limit   18 to 23 years (as on 01-01-2026)       start date for apply   01/12/2025       last date for apply   31/12/2025       official website   https://ssc.gov.in         ssc constable (gd) & rifleman (gd) recruitment 2025 vacancy details         force   male   female   total           bsf   524   92   616       cisf   13135   1460   14595       crpf   5366   124   5490       ssb   1764   0   1764       itbp   1099   194   1293       ar (rifleman gd)   1556   150   1706       ssf   23   0   23       grand total   23467   2020   25487         eligibility criteria     citizen of india   must possess domicile/prc of the state/ut indicated in the application (except assam & specified categories)   matriculation or 10th class pass from a recognized board/university as on 01-01-2026   ncc certificate holders eligible for bonus marks (optional)     age limit (as on 01-01-2026)     minimum age:  18 years   maximum age:  23 years  (born not earlier than 02-01-2003 and not later than 01-01-2008)   age relaxation:	   sc/st: 5 years   obc: 3 years   ex-servicemen: 3 years after deduction of military service   children/dependents of 1984 riot victims (ur/ews): 5 years   children/dependents of 1984 riot victims (obc): 8 years   children/dependents of 1984 riot victims (sc/st): 10 years         application fee     general/obc/ews (male):  ₹100/-   sc/st/ex-servicemen/female candidates:  no fee   payment mode: online (bhim upi, net banking, visa, mastercard, maestro, rupay)     salary/stipend     pay scale: pay level-3   salary range:  ₹21,700 – ₹69,100  per month   all posts carry dearness allowance, house rent allowance, and other allowances as admissible     important dates         notification date   01/12/2025       starting date to apply online   01/12/2025       last date to apply online   31/12/2025 (23:00)       last date for online fee payment   01/01/2026 (23:00)       application form correction window   08/01/2026 to 10/01/2026 (23:00)       tentative cbe exam date   february - april 2026         selection process     computer based examination (cbe)   physical standard test (pst)   physical efficiency test (pet)   detailed medical examination (dme)/review medical examination (rme)   document verification     how to apply     visit official website https://ssc.gov.in   complete one-time registration (otr)   fill the online application form carefully   upload photo, signature & required documents   pay application fee (if applicable)   submit the form and take printout     instruction       read the examination notice carefully in both hindi and english; the english version will be treated as final in case of any dispute.   submit the online application well before the last date to avoid website issues due to heavy traffic.   candidates without one-time registration (otr) on the new ssc website (ssc.gov.in) must create a new otr; old otrs from ssc.nic.in are not valid.   after creating the new otr, candidates can fill out the online application; the new otr will remain valid for future exams on the new site.   documents will be verified during dme by capfs, so applications are provisional; eligibility claims must match the submitted documents or candidature will be cancelled.   candidates claiming reservation (sc/st/obc/ews/esm or others) must ensure eligibility and possess valid certificates in the prescribed format.   sc/st/obc candidates migrating to another state must choose whether to take reservation from their state of origin or apply as unreserved from the state of migration; this choice cannot be changed later.   if opting for reservation from the state of origin, the candidate must provide details of both current domicile and origin, and produce a valid caste certificate from the origin state.     ssc constable (gd) & rifleman (gd) important links     apply link:  click here   official starting date to apply is 01/12/2025.   2. what is the last apply date for ssc constable (gd) 2025?   ans:  last apply date is 31/12/2025.   3. what is the eligibility to apply for ssc constable (gd)
